alert.note: Alert for Wexford (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 9:23AM EDT until April 08 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gaylord MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Manistee River near Sherman affecting Wexford County. .Heavy rain fell in the Manistee River Basin on Tuesday night. Rainfall totals of 1 to 2 inches were common. Runoff from this heavy rain will cause the Manistee River to rise over the next day or so. The Manistee River near Sherman is forecast to rise above flood stage late today. For the Manistee River...including Sherman...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Manistee River near Sherman. * WHEN...From this evening to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins around the Wilderness Canoe livery along left bank of river just downstream of M-37 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 15.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 05/19/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening, or as needed.
